Mohammed VI, the king of unfinished reforms
subhead: 'The Enigma of Mohammed VI' (3/6). The Moroccan king's coronation in 1999 sparked great hope at home and abroad. After the reign of his father, which was marked by human rights abuses, the young monarch personified change and modernity, at least at the beginning.

title: Deadly Israeli strikes on Khan Yunis's Nasser Hospital spark outrage all the way to the White House
subhead: More than 20 people died on Monday, among them medical staff and five journalists. Benjamin Netanyahu was forced to express his regrets, while the Israeli military cited collateral damage. Yet the use of a 'double strike,' a tactic repeatedly employed since the start of the war, undermines that argument.

title: Three soldiers killed in Syria by Israeli strike near Damascus
subhead: A Syrian defense ministry official told AFP that an Israeli drone had targeted one of the military buildings of the 44th division of the Syrian army in Kiswah, west of Damascus. Israel has carried out hundreds of strikes in Syria since an Islamist-led alliance toppled longtime ruler Bashar al-Assad in December.

title: Parents blame ChatGPT for son's suicide in lawsuit against OpenAI
subhead: The parents of a 16-year-old California boy who died by suicide have filed a lawsuit against OpenAI, claiming the company's ChatGPT chatbot fostered a months-long relationship with their son and ultimately provided explicit guidance that contributed to his death.

title: Jacques Rancière, philosopher: 'Today, the people fueled by resentment manufactured by billionaires dominate the public sphere'
subhead: 'May '68 Thinkers Reflect On Trump Era' (1/6). The philosopher of emancipation examines the roots of the current reactionary offensive. He views contemporary utopian micro-communities as new ways of 'living as equals.'

François Truffaut's obsession with Isabelle Adjani
subhead: 'Adjani, The Famous Stranger' (2/6). While making a name for herself at the Comédie Française, the young actress became the French filmmaker's obsession, who courted her insistently on the set of 'The Story of Adèle H.' in 1975. She resisted him and made her mark with a performance full of restrained violence.

title: Life in the West Bank settlement of Kedem Arava: 'We're not taking anyone's place, there is only sand around us'
subhead: Established in 2017 near the Jordanian border, the Kedem Arava settlement contains prefabricated homes housing some 60 families, former city dwellers seeking a life closer to nature. While most residents deny ideological motivation, their presence fully aligns with the annexation of Palestinian territory sought by the Israeli far right.

title: UK's far right mobilizes around asylum crisis: 'I don't want to pay for them anymore'
subhead: Following a court decision upholding the closure of a hotel housing migrants in Epping Forest, opposition to their presence has shown no sign of waning, as seen on Saturday, August 23, in Horley, southern England.
